intro: Ceropegia mahajanii, commonly known as the Mahajan’s arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its succulent, trailing stems and distinctive, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Ceropegia mahajanii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
